data.title: Integrated console: Certain Unicode characters followed by a link cause the link to duplicate itself and jump around when scrolling
data.body:
**EDIT: I now know that it is a duplicate of #26038 (and all its many friends), but maybe the info in here is still useful.**

Version 1.13.0-insider
Commit f977399d58f7b64db35047fafe0c6e59e15f11d5
Date 2017-06-02T10:54:04.063Z
Shell 1.6.6
Renderer 56.0.2924.87
Node 7.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10; 15063.296

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Copy this file somewhere: https://www.dropbox.com/s/3vgfq34mfzfquxs/strange.txt?dl=0
2. Open integrated console with WSL bash
3. `cat` the file from before
4. Scroll the console

Effect:
![Image 1](http://g.recordit.co/aACUwGOh29.gif)

You'll notice that when you scroll, everything looks OK for a moment, but then, half a second after the scrolling action, some words of some lines will replicate themselves at some position more to the left on the same line. Scrolling again will fix it again for half a second, and then it gets unfixed once more, and so on.

It happens outside WSL as well, e.g. with PowerShell (in this example all the border characters are messed up, but that's not the point):
![Image 2](http://g.recordit.co/3tKPNDdHrL.gif)

I got this from running `ssh someserver.com pm2 status`. (On the server, [PM2](https://github.com/Unitech/pm2) was running and linked to keymetrics.io.)

EDIT: Further investigation in devtools shows that both the things which replicate themselves appear to be links, one in a subtle way - as an `xterm-invalid-link`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6010463/27049968-3e4bbf22-4fb1-11e7-8454-2f8ac745ccba.png)

EDIT2: It seems that this is triggered if certain characters are on the same line as a link. For example, try typing `echo ‚óè http://google.com` - it is already messed up:
![Image 3](http://g.recordit.co/p6mxRmRnFm.gif)

EDIT3: Doesn't even have to be an actual scroll as in "change in Y viewport position", just pressing Ctrl+Up on the top line already shows it.

data.title: Improvement: Combine "Complete Emmet Abbreviation" and "Expand Emmet Abbreviation"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (4541e70733f110ada8d0b4266bc922565d74950a, 2017-06-09T05:11:14.033Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.8.0-52-generic
- Extensions: no extensions (I disabled all my extensions)
- Settings:
~~~
{
    "window.zoomLevel": 1,
    "editor.fontSize": 14,
    "editor.tabCompletion": true,
    "editor.quickSuggestions": false,
    "git.autofetch": false
}
~~~
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create empty HTML file
2. Write `scr` and trigger suggestions.
3. You can now choose `script`from the list but you have to trigger the suggestion list once again to expand the `script` tag. Maybe it is possible to complete and expand the `scr` to `<script></script>` in one step?

data.title: Allow debug adapters to report messages to be displayed in status bar (or custom messages)
data.body:
I don't know if this is already possible, but I can't find anything like it.

The debugger I'm using reports some status events that are designed to be shown in the status bar in the IDE. Currently I can write them into the debug output window with an `OutputEvent` but as far as I can tell I can't receive these in the extension to display in the status bar.

I think .NET in (full) VS reports things back to the status bar too (such as loading symbols for DLLs?) so possibly this is useful generally?

Note: If there's already some way to just send custom data back from the debug adapter back to the extension (I guess it's similar to #15656 but in the opposite direction) then that would also satisfy this :-)

data.title: Source control diff views for Index and Working Tree remain open after commit
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Windows 7 SP 1 and 10 RS 2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a folder
2. Git init
3. Add a file with some text
4. Commit the file to source control
5. Make a change to the file
6. Click on the file change in source control to open the diff view
7. Commit the change

The (Working Tree) or (Index) diff view tab will remain open until manually closed.  While working, it doesn't take long before having to stop and manually close a large number of unneeded tabs that are in the way so I can see what I'm actually working on.

data.title: Problem with Higher order function in Python
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.0 (376c52b955428d205459bea6619fc161fc8faacf, 2017-06-08T16:43:13.058Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|vscode-instant-markdown|dbankier|1.1.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.4|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.4|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Code:
``` Python
def lambda_func(func):
    """
    Returns a Curried version of a two-argument function FUNC.
    >>> from operator import add
    >>> lambda_add = lambda_func(add)
    >>> add_three = lambda_add(3)
    >>> add_three(5)
    8
    """
    return lambda x: lambda y: func(x, y)
```
2. show error in return statement "Undefined variable x" , but it works totally fine in Python intepreter

data.title: Typescript service is often stopping working randomly: Cannot read property 'charCount' of undefined
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

May be related to #28112 

I'm not sure how to reproduce it yet. It seems to happen randomly and VERY often. 
Steps:
1. Edit your code (medium to large project)
2. After some time the ts service stops working:
2.1. The validation messages are incorrect and have incorrect location
2.2. Completion and navigation features stops working

Typescript version: 2.3.3, also i didn't have any issues with vscode 1.12.0 

I'm getting this in typescript service output:
```
[Error  - 6:32:24 PM] 'navtree' request failed with error.
Error processing request. Cannot read property 'charCount' of undefined
TypeError: Cannot read property 'charCount' of undefined
    at LineNode.walk (/Users/asvetl/work/applications/frontend/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:78490:47)
    at LineIndex.edit (/Users/asvetl/work/applications/frontend/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:78358:35)
    at ScriptVersionCache.getSnapshot (/Users/asvetl/work/applications/frontend/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:78150:47)
    at TextStorage.getSnapshot (/Users/asvetl/work/applications/frontend/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:73269:32)
    at ScriptInfo.getSnapshot (/Users/asvetl/work/applications/frontend/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:73378:41)
    at LSHost.getScriptSnapshot (/Users/asvetl/work/applications/frontend/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:73648:39)
    at SyntaxTreeCache.getCurrentSourceFile (/Users/asvetl/work/applications/frontend/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:71449:44)
    at Object.getNavigationTree (/Users/asvetl/work/applications/frontend/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:71953:71)
    at IOSession.Session.getNavigationTree (/Users/asvetl/work/applications/frontend/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:77613:62)
    at Session.handlers.ts.createMapFromTemplate._a.(anonymous function) (/Users/asvetl/work/applications/frontend/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js:76670:61)
```

Full log: https://pastebin.com/X6xpSR1z

Thanks

data.title: Cursor width changes randomly because window.zoomLevel interacts with system DPI settings.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Windows 7, 10.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to "Control Panel\Appearance and Personalization\Display", set text size to "Medium - 125%"
2. Set `"window.zoomLevel": 0`, move the cursor around, observe it occasionally being twice as wide:

![vscode cursor width bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/308111/27043241-1fe8d79a-4fa2-11e7-8431-b68ee21c7654.gif)

This is more or less a duplicate of #22904, except the workaround there was to not use `window.zoomLevel` at all, while in my case I'm not using it, it's Chromium deciding to respect the OS setting in a way that breaks vscode rendering if I understand it correctly.

Anyway, I want to add an actual work-around, two even.

1. Set `window.zoomLevel` to ~~-1.25~~ -1.2239 (**edit:** see below comments, that was close enough though) , this will negate the OS setting. 

     The actual formula ~~seems to be `-(OS_zoom - 100) / 20`: each negative point in zoomLevel decreases text size by 20%, in a sense of dividing text size by `1 + 0.2 * zoomLevel`. So if we need to compensate for a 25% increase, we need -1.25 points, and for 50% it's -2.5 points.~~ actually it's 1.2 raised to the power of zoomLevel, positive or negative.

2. Or if you'd prefer a larger UI instead, you can set zoomLevel to 1, this gives you `1.25 * 1.2 = 1.5` combined zoom factor, which apparently doesn't produce the same artifacts.

data.title: Integrated Terminal: Windows 10 Prompting me to associate ng command with a program
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open project folder in VSCode.
2. Ctrl + ` to bring up Integrated Terminal
3. Entered ng serve on Power Shell command line.

Expected Result
Expected ng serve to lunch NG Live Development Server

Actual Result
I get a Windows dialog prompting me to associate ng with a program.

Workaround:
1. Open up a windows cmd prompt
2. cd to the project directory
3. Enter ng serve on the command line
NG Live Development server starts up successfully.

data.title: Squirrel macOS: can easily get into a corrupt warning state

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. download a release that will get an update
2. wait for the update notification to appear
3. quit (do NOT apply the update, just quit)
4. start up again after 1-2 seconds
5. see a warning about VS Code installation being corrupt

Here is what happens:
* Squirrel downloads the update and shows the notification
* User quits
* Squirrel starts to apply the update
* User starts
* Squirrel has not finished applying the update, you are still on the old workbench
* after 10s our integration check kicks in
* by now Squirrel has finished the update
* we show an integrity failure warning because the files have actually changed while we were running

Bottom line: this does NOT reproduce when the user decides to apply the update where we then call `quitAndInstall()` which seems to do everything nicely in one call. What we actually need is a `quitAndInstall` method that does not restart which we should always call when an update is available to prevent this (only really quit when the update is installed).

One thing I verified is that Squirrel is NOT replacing files while Code is still running, only after quit.

/cc @alexandrudima maybe we need to tweak this warning message to ask the user for a restart first to see if that fixes it

data.title: Support Settings for Multi root workspaces
data.body:
This is an umbrella item for support Settings for Multi root workspaces

- [x] Support reading configuration in multi root set up
- [x] Support writing configuration in multi root set up
- [x] Distinguish workspace and folder scoped settings
- [x] Provisional API for reading configurations in multi root context

data.title: executeDocumentSymbolProvider returns an empty list when executed in parallel?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0-insider
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install two extensions that both try to call `executeDocumentSymbolProvider` (in my case Git Lens and Code Outline)
2. Restart the editor
3. Observe that as both extensions immediately call `executeDocumentSymbolProvider` the second extension gets an empty list of symbols

Slightly off topic: wouldn't it be nice if there was a `TextEditor.getDocumentSymbols()` or even a `TextDocument.getSymbols()` that took care of parallelism and caching internally (ie. do not re-execute the provider until the document changes)?

data.title: Exceptions not working properly
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.13.0 - OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.5 / Windows 10 Enterprise 1607 **Steps to Reproduce:** 1. Open a .NET Core project (reproduced with .NET Core 1.1) 2. Add a line which causes an exception (division by 0 for example or even `Debug.Assert(false)`) 3. Run the code in debug **Expected behaviour:** Visual Studio Code breaks on the line and display exception, as in previous version. **Actual behaviour:** Visual Studio Code breaks but doesn't show the line and the exception. The debug panel remains empty for every thread. I reproduced this bug also on latest Insider version (1.14.0). I also reproduced it on a fresh install with only Omnisharp extension (ms-vscode.csharp) in 1.10.0, 1.11.0-beta and 1.9.0 to be sure that it's a Visual Studio Code issue.

data.title: Under tasks/command the env.EnvironmentVariableName (eg. env.graphviz) does no expand.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Win 7 Pro 64 Bit

Calling a task with "command": "${env.graphviz}/dot.exe" does not expand any more with vscode 1.13.0.
But calling with "command": "%graphviz%/dot.exe" does

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create an env "graphviz" like "c:\tools\graphviz\bin" under windows env dialog
2. create a task.json file with 
"version": "0.1.0",
"tasks": [
{
"isShellCommand": true,
"showOutput": "always",
"echoCommand": true,
"suppressTaskName": true,
"command": "${env.graphviz}/dot.exe",
"taskname": "graphviz svg",
"args": ["-Tsvg", "${file}", "-o", "${fileDirname}/${fileBaseNameNoExtension}.svg"]
}
...
]

I get the output:
 '${env.graphviz}' is not recognized as an internal or external command,...

data.title: Change All Occurrences GUI is hard to use
data.body:
I was struggling to use Change All Occurrences because it seemed to locate occurences within words and irrespective of case, which seemed wrong. I guessed that maybe it uses the settings from the Find dialog box, but I also noticed that when selecting Change All Occurrences from the context menu, the case sensitivity and match word 'buttons' appear briefly in the top right hand corner.

Is this to indicate what the search settings are? If you're fast you can click the buttons.

I think it would be nicer to have separate settings for the Change All Occurrences - I would nearly always expect searches to be case sensitive and to match whole words, as I use it to rename variables.

It would also be nice if the buttons stayed around a bit longer?
